title.narrative: Cost-efficiency savings on use of Integrated Digital Platform by GOB agencies
Revenue of IT industry firms supported by the Project activities
Trainees satisfied with the training provided by BCC
Use of Bangladesh National Digital Architecture by GOB agencies
Increase in digital integration across GOB agencies through the use of the IDP
Digitally enabled jobs created by the Project
GOB Ministries and Divisions with improved end-point cyber security
Digital development-related guidelines, policies and/or regulations drafted and submitted to the relevant higher authorities
Digital economy activities (training, research and innovation topics, business development support, etc.) that incorporated beneficiary feedback into its selection and design
Civil servants government email accounts protected by encryption
Relevant civil servants undertaken 1 or more digital government skills courses
Training, Research and Innovation Centers (TRICs) established
Women who have been trained and gained marketable digital economy skills
Bangladeshi youth trained in digital and/or emerging technologies
Government districts and upzilas with improved cyber-attack monitoring and response capabilities
Of which have gender-informed additions proposed
